cves.vulnerabilityName: Fortinet FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Fortinet FortiOS SSL VPN web portal contains a path traversal vulnerability that may allow an unauthenticated attacker to download FortiOS system files through specially crafted HTTP resource requests.
A directory traversal vulnerability exists in the administrator console in Adobe ColdFusion which allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files.
Adobe BlazeDS, which is utilized in LifeCycle and Coldfusion, contains a vulnerability that allows for information disclosure.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Exchange Server contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows for remote code execution.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Exchange Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Exchange Server contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows for privilege escalation.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Exchange Server Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Exchange Server contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows for security feature bypass.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft SharePoint fails to check the source markup of an application package. An attacker who successfully exploits the vulnerability could run remote code in the context of the SharePoint application pool and the SharePoint server farm account.

Microsoft's Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC) contains a privilege escalation vulnerability when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller. An attacker who successfully exploits the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. The vulnerability is also known under the moniker of Zerologon.
cves.notes: Reference CISA's ED 20-04 (https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-20-04-mitigate-netlogon-elevation-privilege-vulnerability-august-2020-patch-tuesday) for further guidance and requirements. Note: The due date for addressing this vulnerability aligns with the requirements outlined in ED 20-04. https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-1472

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows Group Policy Preferences Password Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Active Directory contains a privilege escalation vulnerability due to the way it distributes passwords that are configured using Group Policy preferences. An authenticated attacker who successfully exploits the vulnerability could decrypt the passwords and use them to elevate privileges on the domain.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows Server Message Block (SMBv1) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows for remote code execution.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft SMBv1 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: The SMBv1 server in multiple Microsoft Windows versions allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted packets.
